snippet.description:
Laura Bradley, an award-winning middle school English teacher with three decades of experience, describes leading her eighth-grade students through National Novel Writing Month (aka November), a challenge to write a 50,000-word novel in 30 days. 

Learn more: https://www.edutopia.org/article/young-authors-challenge-writing-novel-30-days

Learn more about the Young Writers Program of National Novel Writing Month here: https://ywp.nanowrimo.org/

Watch a video of Laura's students talking about their experiences: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=REQwjA8OyPM
snippet.title: Young Authors Challenge: Writing A Novel in 30 Days

snippet.description:
Sal Khan founded a school on the same principles of personalization that drove the success of his YouTube tutorials.

Learn more: https://www.edutopia.org/article/school-built-personalization

Learn more about Khan Lab School: http://khanlabschool.org/

Learn more about Khan Academy: https://www.khanacademy.org/
snippet.title: Supercharging the Classroom: Using Technology to Support Personalized Learning

snippet.description:
Emily Pilloton, Founder of Studio H, a design/build class at REALM Charter School and Girls Garage both in Berkeley, California, describes how she “knew there were things about architecture and design that could have a deep impact in the classroom.”

Learn more: https://www.edutopia.org/article/changing-who-gets-make-world-tom-berger

Learn more about Studio H: http://studio-h.org/

Watch a video of one of Emily's students talking about his experiences: https://youtu.be/2pEAXNzc5Fo
snippet.title: Makers Of The World: Engaging Kids Through Building and Design

snippet.description:
Aukeem Ballard, a teacher at Summit Preparatory Charter High School, in Redwood City, CA, discusses the power of mentors in his life and career, comparing having a mentor to standing on the shoulders of giants.

Learn more: https://www.edutopia.org/article/push-right-direction

Watch a video of one of Aukeem's students talking about his experiences: https://youtu.be/ECqCFWw4sgU

Learn more about this school: https://www.edutopia.org/school/summit-preparatory-charter-high-school
snippet.title: Integrating Social and Emotional Support for Students Through Mentorship

snippet.description:
Gia Truong, CEO of Envision Schools, a network three high schools that serve mainly low-income black and Latino students who are working to be the first in their families to go to college, describes how Envision is creating a supportive culture that “interrupts education inequity.”

Learn more: https://www.edutopia.org/article/school-wide-culture-equity

Learn more about supporting first-generation college students: https://www.tgslc.org/pdf/files-sfts_what_works.pdf

Watch a video of an Envision Academy graduate talking about her experiences: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yHxE5Ylmvzg
snippet.title: Equity in Education: Empowering First-Generation Students to Succeed
